thread.title: Ground News - Holiday travelers unfazed by winter weather in Chicago

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Holiday travelers unfazed by winter weather in Chicago
text:
Summary by Ground News AAA projected that 115 million Americans would travel during the stretch between Dec. 23 and Jan. 1. Protests caused delays in New York City on the first day of the new year. Travelers at TSA checkpoints surpassed 2.6 million every day between the 26th and 29th. Share menu More

WGN 9 Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Nexstar Media Group Media Conglomerate: Tribune Media Holiday travelers unfazed by winter weather in Chicago CHICAGO — Winter weather did not stand in the way for holiday travelers in the Chicago area in 2023. A meltdown at airports involving Southwest Airlines in 2022 made some people wary of travel this holiday season, but it wasn’t enough to stop everyone as travel was back up to pre-pandemic levels. AAA projected that […]
